input_text:
Job Title: Full Stack Engineer (Python & React) - Remote US, LATAM, Europe

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Description

Hours per week: 40 hours

Interview process: 2-3 interview rounds with Reddit

Start date: ASAP

For international contractors, this is structured as a freelance engagement. For those based in the US, it is classified as a W2 engagement.

Reddit is a community of communities where people can dive into anything through experiences built around their interests, hobbies, and passions. Our mission is to bring community, belonging, and empowerment to everyone in the world. Reddit users submit, vote, and comment on content, stories, and discussions about the topics they care about the most. From pets to parenting, there's a community for everybody on Reddit and with over 50 million daily active users, it is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet. For more information, visit redditinc.com.

At Reddit we work hard to earn our users' trust every day as we work towards our vision to create a welcoming experience where anyone in the world feels a sense of belonging. Safety Tools is a close-knit team, working tirelessly towards protecting mods and their communities from bad actors and building safety tooling at scale to help our own admins safeguard these spaces.

Safety Tools team members are motivated to find innovative, state of the art solutions, leveraging ML models and user insights to pursue the highest possible quality and safety standards for users across our products.

If ensuring the safety of users, moderators and communities on one of the most popular websites in the world excites you, then you've found the right place. We're a fast-growing company but still maintain one of the highest user to employee ratios in the industry, giving you a tremendous opportunity for both scope and impact.

Responsibilities:

 Be part of a team that's building a highly scalable, high quality, and low latency web platform at Reddit's scale. Partner and collaborate with partner teams to deliver high quality UI components Tackle tough design and product problems. Work cross-functionally with design, product, and engineering to deliver great user experiences. Contribute to the full development cycle: technical design, development, testing, experimentation, analysis, and launch. You'll be

reviewing code and design docs, and giving feedback on product specs and mocks.

Who You Might Be

 4+ years of industry experience as a Software Engineer developing production code Experience with React and Python Exposure to design patterns of large, high-scale web applications, such as well-designed APIs, high volume data pipelines, and efficient

algorithms

 Entrepreneurial and self-directed, innovative, biased towards action in fast-paced environments. Able to communicate and discuss complex topics with technical and non-technical audiences. Able to tackle ambiguous and undefined problems.

Must be available for daily stand up meetings around 10-12pm PST

Location restrictions:

This role is open to applicants from the following countries: Argentina, Armenia, Australia, Azerbaijan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Canada, Chile, Colombia, Cyprus, Dominican Republic, Egypt, El Salvador, and the European Economic Area (EEA), which includes Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway. Additionally, applicants from the European Union (EU) are welcome; this includes Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Republic of Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, and Sweden. Other eligible countries include Guatemala, Mexico, Montenegro, Panama, Peru, Republic of North Macedonia, Serbia, Singapore, Switzerland, Tunisia, Turkey, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom (UK), United States (US), and Uruguay.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
